items.name: afterRenderSchedule
items.description: Fire this event by every single schedule after rendering whole calendar.

examples.code: calendar.on('afterRenderSchedule', function(event) { var schedule = event.schedule; var element = calendar.getElement(schedule.id, schedule.calendarId); // use the element console.log(element); });

items.name: beforeCreateSchedule
items.description: Fire this event when select time period in daily, weekly, monthly.

examples.code: calendar.on('beforeCreateSchedule', function(event) { var startTime = event.start; var endTime = event.end; var isAllDay = event.isAllDay; var guide = event.guide; var triggerEventName = event.triggerEventName; var schedule; if (triggerEventName === 'click') { // open writing simple schedule popup schedule = {...}; } else if (triggerEventName === 'dblclick') { // open writing detail schedule popup schedule = {...}; } calendar.createSchedules([schedule]); });

items.name: beforeDeleteSchedule
items.description: Fire this event when delete a schedule.

examples.code: calendar.on('beforeDeleteSchedule', function(event) { var schedule = event.schedule; alert('The schedule is removed.', schedule); });

items.name: beforeUpdateSchedule
items.description: Fire this event when drag a schedule to change time in daily, weekly, monthly.

examples.code: calendar.on('beforeUpdateSchedule', function(event) { var schedule = event.schedule; var startTime = event.start; var endTime = event.end; calendar.updateSchedule(schedule.id, schedule.calendarId, { start: startTime, end: endTime }); });

items.name: changeView(newViewName, force)
items.description: Change current view with view name('day', 'week', 'month')

params.name: newViewName
params.description: The New view name to render

params.name: force
params.description: Force render despite of current view and new view are equal

examples.code: // daily view calendar.changeView('day', true); // weekly view calendar.changeView('week', true); // monthly view(default 6 weeks view) calendar.setOptions({month: {visibleWeeksCount: 6}}, true); // or null calendar.changeView('month', true); // 2 weeks monthly view calendar.setOptions({month: {visibleWeeksCount: 2}}, true); calendar.changeView('month', true); // 3 weeks monthly view calendar.setOptions({month: {visibleWeeksCount: 3}}, true); calendar.changeView('month', true); // narrow weekend calendar.setOptions({month: {narrowWeekend: true}}, true); calendar.setOptions({week: {narrowWeekend: true}}, true); calendar.changeView(calendar.getViewName(), true); // change start day of week(from monday) calendar.setOptions({week: {startDayOfWeek: 1}}, true); calendar.setOptions({month: {startDayOfWeek: 1}}, true); calendar.changeView(calendar.getViewName(), true); // work week calendar.setOptions({week: {workweek: true}}, true); calendar.setOptions({month: {workweek: true}}, true); calendar.changeView(calendar.getViewName(), true);

items.name: clear(immediately)
items.description:
Delete all schedules and clear view. The real rendering occurs after requestAnimationFrame.
If you have to render immediately, use the 'immediately' parameter as true.

examples.code: calendar.clear(); calendar.createSchedules(schedules, true); calendar.render();

items.name: clickDayname
items.description: Fire this event when click a day name in weekly.

examples.code: calendar.on('clickDayname', function(event) { if (calendar.getViewName() === 'week') { calendar.setDate(new Date(event.date)); calendar.changeView('day', true); } });

items.name: clickMore
items.description: Fire this event when click a schedule.

examples.code: calendar.on('clickMore', function(event) { console.log('clickMore', event.date, event.target); });

items.name: clickSchedule
items.description: Fire this event when click a schedule.

examples.code: calendar.on('clickSchedule', function(event) { var schedule = event.schedule; if (lastClickSchedule) { calendar.updateSchedule(lastClickSchedule.id, lastClickSchedule.calendarId, { isFocused: false }); } calendar.updateSchedule(schedule.id, schedule.calendarId, { isFocused: true }); lastClickSchedule = schedule; // open detail view });

items.name: clickTimezonesCollapseBtn
items.description: Fire this event by clicking timezones collapse button

examples.code: calendar.on('clickTimezonesCollapseBtn', function(timezonesCollapsed) { console.log(timezonesCollapsed); });

items.name: createSchedules(schedules, silent)
items.description: Create schedules and render calendar.

params.name: silent
params.description: no auto render after creation when set true

examples.code: calendar.createSchedules([ { id: '1', calendarId: '1', title: 'my schedule', category: 'time', dueDateClass: '', start: '2018-01-18T22:30:00+09:00', end: '2018-01-19T02:30:00+09:00' }, { id: '2', calendarId: '1', title: 'second schedule', category: 'time', dueDateClass: '', start: '2018-01-18T17:30:00+09:00', end: '2018-01-19T17:31:00+09:00' } ]);

items.name: deleteSchedule(scheduleId, calendarId, silent)
items.description: Delete a schedule.

params.name: calendarId
params.description: The CalendarId of the schedule to delete

params.name: silent
params.description: No auto render after creation when set true

items.name: destroy()
items.description: destroy calendar instance.

items.name: getDate()
items.description: Current rendered date (TZDate for further information)

items.name: getDateRangeEnd()
items.description: End time of rendered date range (TZDate for further information)

items.name: getDateRangeStart()
items.description: Start time of rendered date range (TZDate for further information)

items.name: getElement(scheduleId, calendarId)
items.description: Get a schedule element by schedule id and calendar id.

examples.code: var element = calendar.getElement(scheduleId, calendarId); console.log(element);

returns.description: schedule element if found or null

items.name: getOptions()
items.description: Get current Options.

items.name: getSchedule(scheduleId, calendarId)
items.description: Get a Schedule object by schedule id and calendar id.

examples.code: var schedule = calendar.getSchedule(scheduleId, calendarId); console.log(schedule.title);

items.name: getViewName()
items.description: Get current view name('day', 'week', 'month')

items.name: hideMoreView()
items.description: Hide the more view

items.name: new Calendar(container, options)
items.description: Calendar class

params.name: container
params.description: The container element or selector id

examples.code: var calendar = new tui.Calendar(document.getElementById('calendar'), { defaultView: 'week', taskView: true, // Can be also ['milestone', 'task'] scheduleView: true, // Can be also ['allday', 'time'] template: { milestone: function(schedule) { return '<span style="color:red;"><i class="fa fa-flag"></i> ' + schedule.title + '</span>'; }, milestoneTitle: function() { return 'Milestone'; }, task: function(schedule) { return '  #' + schedule.title; }, taskTitle: function() { return '<label><input type="checkbox" />Task</label>'; }, allday: function(schedule) { return schedule.title + ' <i class="fa fa-refresh"></i>'; }, alldayTitle: function() { return 'All Day'; }, time: function(schedule) { return schedule.title + ' <i class="fa fa-refresh"></i>' + schedule.start; } }, month: { daynames: ['Sun', 'Mon', 'Tue', 'Wed', 'Thu', 'Fri', 'Sat'], startDayOfWeek: 0, narrowWeekend: true }, week: { daynames: ['Sun', 'Mon', 'Tue', 'Wed', 'Thu', 'Fri', 'Sat'], startDayOfWeek: 0, narrowWeekend: true } });

items.name: next()
items.description: Move the calendar forward a day, a week, a month, 2 weeks, 3 weeks.

examples.code: function moveToNextOrPrevRange(val) { if (val === -1) { calendar.prev(); } else if (val === 1) { calendar.next(); } }

items.name: openCreationPopup(schedule)
items.description: Open schedule creation popup

items.name: prev()
items.description: Move the calendar backward a day, a week, a month, 2 weeks, 3 weeks.

examples.code: function moveToNextOrPrevRange(val) { if (val === -1) { calendar.prev(); } else if (val === 1) { calendar.next(); } }

items.name: render(immediately)
items.description:
Render the calendar. The real rendering occurs after requestAnimationFrame.
If you have to render immediately, use the 'immediately' parameter as true.

examples.code: var silent = true; calendar.clear(); calendar.createSchedules(schedules, silent); calendar.render();
// Render a calendar when resizing a window. window.addEventListener('resize', function() { calendar.render(); });

items.name: scrollToNow()
items.description: Scroll to current time on today in case of daily, weekly view

examples.code: function onNewSchedules(schedules) { calendar.createSchedules(schedules); if (calendar.getViewName() !== 'month') { calendar.scrollToNow(); } }

items.name: setCalendarColor(calendarId, option, silent)
items.description: Change calendar's schedule color with option

params.name: silent
params.description: No auto render after creation when set true

examples.code: calendar.setCalendarColor('1', { color: '#e8e8e8', bgColor: '#585858', borderColor: '#a1b56c' }); calendar.setCalendarColor('2', { color: '#282828', bgColor: '#dc9656', borderColor: '#a1b56c' }); calendar.setCalendarColor('3', { color: '#a16946', bgColor: '#ab4642', borderColor: '#a1b56c' });

items.name: setCalendars(calendars)
items.description: Set calendar list

items.name: setDate(date)
items.description: Move to specific date

examples.code: calendar.on('clickDayname', function(event) { if (calendar.getViewName() === 'week') { calendar.setDate(new Date(event.date)); calendar.changeView('day', true); } });

items.name: setOptions(options, silent)
items.description: Set options of calendar

params.name: silent
params.description: no auto render after creation when set true

items.name: setTheme(theme)
items.description: Set a theme. If some keys are not defined in the preset, will be return.

examples.code: cal.setTheme({ 'month.dayname.height': '31px', 'common.dayname.color': '#333', 'month.dayname.borderBottom': '1px solid #e5e5e5' // Not valid key will be return. });

items.name: setTimezoneOffset(offset)
items.description: Set timezone offset

examples.code: var timezoneName = moment.tz.guess(); tui.Calendar.setTimezoneOffset(moment.tz.zone(timezoneName).utcOffset(moment()));

items.name: setTimezoneOffsetCallback(callback)
items.description: Set a callback function to get timezone offset by timestamp

examples.code: var timezoneName = moment.tz.guess(); tui.Calendar.setTimezoneOffsetCallback(function(timestamp) { return moment.tz.zone(timezoneName).utcOffset(timestamp)); });

items.name: today()
items.description: Move to today.

examples.code: function onClickTodayBtn() { calendar.today(); }

items.name: toggleSchedules(calendarId, toHide, render)
items.description: Toggle schedules' visibility by calendar ID

params.name: render
params.description: set true then render after change visible property each models

examples.code: // hide those view panel to show only 'Milestone', 'Task' calendar.toggleScheduleView(false); // show those view panel. calendar.toggleScheduleView(true);
// There is no milestone, task, so hide those view panel calendar.toggleTaskView(false); // There are some milestone, task, so show those view panel. calendar.toggleTaskView(true);

items.name: updateSchedule(scheduleId, calendarId, scheduleData, silent)
items.description: Update the schedule

params.name: scheduleId
params.description: ID of a schedule to update

params.name: calendarId
params.description: The calendarId of the schedule to update

params.name: silent
params.description: No auto render after creation when set true

examples.code: calendar.on('beforeUpdateSchedule', function(event) { var schedule = event.schedule; var startTime = event.start; var endTime = event.end; calendar.updateSchedule(schedule.id, schedule.calendarId, { start: startTime, end: endTime }); });
